	The officer is responsible for deepening investor&rsquo;s relationships, exploring funding opportunities, and educating the customers on the numerous opportunities to grow their wealth by investing in the company&rsquo;s wealth creation products within the provisions of the regulatory guidelines and organizational policies.

Funds Mobilization Officer (Investment) Job at Rosabon Financial Services




        
    

        
        Rosabon Financial Services (RFS) Limited - Award winning Rosabon Financial Services is a member of the Concept Group. Licensed by the Central Bank of Nigeria, CBN on April 22, 1993 and being a long standing member of the Equipment Leasing Association of Nigeria (ELAN), the organization has evolved into Nigeria’s leading Non-Banking Financial Intermediary and Equipment Leasing firm focused on niche and general markets.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Funds Mobilization Officer (Investment)

Job Location: Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Scope
     

            
    




	The Fund Mobilization officer (IMTT) proactively sources for fund placements from individuals and corporate organizations using both the company’s offline and online channel in attracting customers to invest in the fund placement products.
	The officer is responsible for deepening investor’s relationships, exploring funding opportunities, and educating the customers on the numerous opportunities to grow their wealth by investing in the company’s wealth creation products within the provisions of the regulatory guidelines and organizational policies.
	This role is highly competitive and adequately incentivized with commission and productivity bonus in addition to a base salary.


Job Description


	Market and Sell the company’s fund investment products to individuals: Promote and sell fund placement products to individual and corporate bodies
	Promote digital channels adoption: They interact with existing and potential customers on using the company’s Wealth Creation Investment App
	Customer Engagement: Build relationship with customers , understand the financial needs and guide them on using the Wealth Management App
	Product knowledge: Stay up to-date on company treasury products and services to effectively communicate their value to the customers
	Customer Education: Educate customers on the benefits of the fund placements products, and guide them on how to utilize the company’s products and service their wealth maximization.


Performance Metrics


	Sales targets: Meet or exceed sales targets for treasury products.
	Customer acquisition: Acquire new customers and grow the customer base.
	Customer satisfaction: Ensure high customer satisfaction ratings through effective service delivery.
	Digital channel adoption: Increase adoption rates of the company's digital channels, particularly the WealthManagementapp.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess an HND / OND qualification.


Salary
N80,00 - N120,000 monthly.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: sales.careers@conceptgroup-ng.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Job Openings at Ambiance Cafeteria
content:
Ambiance Cafeteria has been in business for years and has grown into a premier name in the hospitality industry, offering a seamless blend of comfort, entertainment, and culinary excellence. what began as a single hospitality venture has evolved into a dynamic enterprise comprising a luxury hotel, a vibrant nightclub, an upscale restaurant, and a selection of stylishbars. With a commitment to outstanding guest experiences, AMBIANCE CAFETERIA has consistently set new standards in service, ambiance, and innovation. Each facet of the business reflects a dedication to quality, from the refined accomodations of our hotel to the immersive atmosphere of our nightlife venues and the exceptional cuisine served in our restaurant. Over the years, AMBIANCE CAFETERIA has become a preferred destination for both local and international guests, earning a reputation for excellence and reliability in the hospitality sector. Our continued growth is driven by passion for hospitality and a vision to create memorable experiences for every guest.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) IT Officer

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a skilled and reliable IT Officer with a minimum of 3 years’ experience in the hospitality industry to manage and support our IT systems.
	The ideal candidate will ensure the smooth operation of hotel systems, provide technical support to staff, and maintain secure, efficient IT infrastructure that supports daily hotel operations.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage and maintain hotel IT systems, including PMS, POS, accounting, and reservation systems
	Provide day-to-day technical support to hotel staff and departments
	Maintain and troubleshoot network infrastructure, servers, workstations, printers, and Wi-Fi systems
	Ensure data security, system backups, and compliance with IT policies
	Coordinate with vendors and service providers for hardware, software, and system upgrades
	Monitor system performance and resolve issues promptly to minimize downtime
	Train staff on basic system usage and IT best practices
	Maintain accurate IT documentation and asset inventories


Requirements & Qualifications


	Bachelor’s degree or diploma in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field
	Minimum of 3 years of proven IT experience within the hospitality industry
	Strong knowledge of hotel systems (PMS, POS, CCTV, access control, and guest Wi-Fi)
	Experience with network administration, hardware support, and system troubleshooting
	Good understanding of data security, backups, and disaster recovery
	Excellent problem-solving and communication skills
	Ability to work independently and handle multiple tasks under pressure


Preferred Skills:


	Experience with hotel brands or multi-property environments
	Knowledge of cloud-based systems and virtualization
	Vendor management experience.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary and benefits
	Supportive and professional work environment
	Opportunities for career growth and development.


Application Closing Date: 31st December, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Application letter to: ambiancehr18@gmail.com using “IT Officer – Immediate Start” as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) In-house Electrician

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	We are seeking a highly skilled and reliable Experienced In-House Electrician to join our team.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for maintaining, repairing, and improving electrical systems across our facility to ensure safety, efficiency, and full operational functionality.


Key Responsibilities


	Perform routine electrical maintenance, repairs, and inspections across the property/facility.
	Troubleshoot electrical issues and complete corrective actions promptly.
	Install, maintain, and upgrade electrical wiring, equipment, and fixtures according to safety standards.
	Ensure compliance with local electrical codes, health & safety regulations, and company policies.
	Conduct preventative maintenance and recommend improvements to reduce downtime.
	Collaborate with maintenance teams, contractors, and management on technical projects.
	Maintain accurate maintenance logs, reports, and equipment documentation.


Requirements


	Trade qualification or certification as an Electrician (e.g., NVQ Level 3, City & Guilds, or equivalent).
	Minimum of 3 years of experience in electrical maintenance; in-house or facilities experience preferred.
	Strong knowledge of electrical systems, safety procedures, and diagnostic tools.
	Ability to read and interpret technical diagrams and schematics.
	Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
	Ability to work independently and respond to urgent issues as needed.
	Good communication and teamwork skills.


Benefits


	Competitive salary and other benefits
	Training and professional development
	Supportive working environment
	Flexible work schedule.


Application Closing Date: 25th December, 2025. 

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their resume to: ambiancehr18@gmail.com using “In-House Electrician - Immediate start” as the subject of the email.

Note: For more enquires, contact: 08086458262.

 

 

3.) Cook / Chef

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	We are looking for a skilled and passionate Cook / Chef to join our dynamic team.
	The ideal candidate must have strong experience in food preparation, menu execution, and kitchen management, with the ability to deliver high-quality dishes consistently.


Key Responsibilities


	Prepare and cook meals according to established recipes and standards
	Ensure proper portioning, presentation, and overall food quality
	Maintain a clean, organized, and hygienic kitchen environment
	Manage inventory and assist in ordering kitchen supplies
	Work with management to develop or improve menu items
	Comply with all food safety and sanitation regulations
	Support kitchen staff and maintain smooth operation during service hours.


Requirements


	Minimum 4 – 5  years of experience as a cook or chef (hotel, restaurant, or club experience preferred)
	Strong knowledge of food preparation techniques and kitchen operations
	Ability to deliver quality meals on time
	Excellent teamwork and communication skills
	Creativity and passion for culinary excellence.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary and incentives
	A supportive and professional work environment
	Opportunities for growth and skill development
	Meals and staff benefits.


Application Closing Date: 29th December, 2025. 

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their resume to: ambiancehr18@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: For more enquires, contact: 08086458262.

 

 

4.) Laundry Attendant

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	We are seeking reliable and detail-oriented Laundry Personnel to join our team.
	The ideal candidate will have at least 2 years of relevant experience in laundry operations and a strong commitment to cleanliness, organization, and efficiency.
	You will play a key role in ensuring our linens, uniforms, and fabrics are processed to the highest standards.


Key Responsibilities


	Operate washers, dryers, steamers, and other laundry equipment safely and efficiently
	Sort, wash, dry, fold, and iron laundry items according to fabric care requirements
	Inspect items for stains, damage, or repair needs
	Maintain the cleanliness of the laundry area and equipment
	Manage inventory of detergents, cleaning supplies, and linens
	Adhere to quality control and hygiene standards
	Ensure timely delivery of cleaned items to relevant departments


Qualifications


	Minimum 2 years of relevant experience in laundry operations (hotel, commercial laundry, or similar environment)
	Knowledge of fabric care, stain removal techniques, and equipment handling
	Strong attention to detail and time-management skills
	Ability to lift and carry loads of laundry and stand for extended periods
	Good communication and teamwork skills.


What We Offer


	Competitive compensation
	Supportive work environment
	Opportunities for growth and skill development.


Application Closing Date: 26th December, 2025. 

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their resume to: ambiancehr18@gmail.com using “Laundry Attendant" as the subject of the

title: Job Openings at Lisse Africa
content:
Lisse Africa is a dynamic human resource consulting firm with key interest in recruitment with the aim of providing employees that are professional, verified and with a good cultural fit. At Lisse Africa, our aim is to build the world's most valued Recruitment Solution Company to Clients, Candidates, Colleagues and the communities where we work and live with regards to staff recruitment, background verification and other HR solutions.

We solely focus on the enhancement of client organizations by providing quality services on various aspects of their human resources and by letting the organization focus on its core issues.

We are recruiting suitable candidates to fill the following positions below:
     

            
    



1.) Residential Chef

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Accommodation: Yes

Responsibilities


	Cooking various healthy meals
	Preparing customized meal plans for the client based on their preferences, specifications, and dietary needs.
	Shopping for meal ingredients as well as necessary kitchen tools and equipment.
	Inspecting meal ingredients before making purchases to ensure that they are of the highest quality.
	Preparing meals in client’s kitchens in accordance with food health and safety regulations.
	Cleaning and sanitizing work areas before and after meal preparation.
	Appropriately packaging and labeling prepared meals that are to be consumed at a later date.
	Providing clients with written or verbal instructions on how to heat meals.


Requirements


	Minimum of SSCE qualification with 3 years of experience.
	Proven culinary experience.
	Sound knowledge of different cuisines, as well as food health and safety regulations.
	Excellent organizational and time management skills.
	Effective communication skills.


Application Closing Date: 30th December, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: tegarecruits@gmail.com using "Residential Chef" as the subject of the mail.

 

 

2.) Private Driver

Job Location: Ikate, Lekki - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Map out driving routes ahead of time to determine the most expedient trip.
	Listen to traffic and weather reports to stay up-to-date on road conditions.
	Adjust the route to avoid heavy traffic or road constructions, as needed.
	Ensure the car seats are clean and comfortable for all riders.
	Schedule regular car service appointments and report any issues.
	Maintain the car and detailing services to maintain interior and exterior cleanliness of the car.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess an SSCE qualification with a minimum of 2 years of experience.
	Proven experience as a Driver.
	A valid driver’s license.
	A clean driving record.
	Familiarity with GPS devices.
	Knowledge of area roads and neighborhoods.
	Someone around Lekki/Ajah is preferred.


Salary
N150,000 - 200,000 Monthly.

Application Closing Date: 30th December, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: tegarecruits@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: No Accommondation.

 

 

3.) Customer Service Representative

Job Location: Lekki Phase 1, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We’re looking for a Customer Service/Sales Representative to attend to walk-in customers, promote products, and ensure a pleasant shopping experience.


Responsibilities


	Attend to customers in the store and provide excellent service.
	Promote and explain product features and benefits to customers.
	Maintain proper display and arrangement of products.
	Record daily sales and provide accurate reports.
	Keep the sales area clean, organized, and well-stocked.
	Assist in inventory checks and restocking when needed.
	Handle customer inquiries and feedback professionally.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess a minimum of SSCE / GCE / NECO with a minimum of 1 year of work experience.
	Must reside around Lekki as there is no accommodation.


Salary
N150,000 Monthly.

Application Closing Date: 30th December, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: tegarecruits@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

4.) Filipino House Manager

Job Location: Ikoyi, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Household Management: Oversee the general operation of the home, ensuring it is well-maintained and organized.
	This includes managing household schedules, supervising maintenance projects, and handling household bills and administrative duties.
	Staff Supervision: Manage and coordinate household staff, including housekeepers, chefs, and other employees, ensuring tasks are performed efficiently and effectively.
	Budget Management: Responsible for managing household budgets, tracking expenses, and reconciling accounts to maintain financial balance.
	Event Planning: Plan and coordinate social events, such as dinner parties or family gatherings, ensuring all details are managed.
	Inventory Management: Keep track of household supplies and inventory, placing orders as needed to ensure the household runs smoothly.
	Communication: Serve as the primary point of contact for household-related inquiries and maintain clear communication with family members and staff.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess relevant qualifications with 3 years of experience
	Nationality: Must be Filipino.


Salary
$1,000 monthly.

Application Closing Date: 20th January, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: tegarecruits@gmail.com using "Filipino House Manager" as the subject of the mail.

	We are seeking a meticulous and proactive Procurement Finance Officer to support our procurement and finance operations.


Responsibilities
The Procurement Finance Officer will ensure financial accuracy, cost efficiency and verification of all procurement-related transactions. Key duties include:


	Verifying and confirming that all prices of items requested or purchased are accurate, competitive and properly approved.
	Reviewing vendor quotations, invoices, purchase orders and supporting documents for correctness and compliance with company standards.
	Ensuring cost-saving measures are incorporated into procurement activities.
	Supporting procurement processes by validating pricing, quantities and vendor details before final approval.
	Maintaining an updated database of vendor price lists and market rates.
	Identifying price discrepancies and escalating issues for prompt resolution.
	Collaborating with the Procurement and Finance teams to ensure seamless execution of purchasing activities.
	Assisting in the reconciliation of procurement transactions and expenditure reports.
	Participating in vendor evaluation and maintaining proper procurement documentation.


Requirements


	HND / B.Sc. in Accounting, Finance, Economics, Business Administration or any related field with a minimum qualification of Upper Credit or Second Class Upper Division.

	Sound understanding of pricing verification and basic procurement procedures.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and basic accounting tools.
	Strong communication, documentation and coordination skills.
	Ability to work with accuracy under pressure and meet deadlines.


Benefits


	Competitive salary and benefits package
	Opportunities for career development and training
	A supportive and collaborative work environment.
